item.title: 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open!
item.description: The 2026 McKinney Writing Contest is open from November 1, 2025 through March 9, 2026. Submit in any or all of the following categories: Fiction, Creative Nonfiction, or Drama; Poetry; Academic Essay; Language & Image; or our NEW category: Writing for Games. Undergraduate and graduate divisions. First prize $300; 2nd prize $175; and 3rd prize $75. Submit: https://hass.rpi.edu/mckinney. Submit in fall for December graduates. Questions? McKinney@rpi.edu

item.title: 11/5 Cognitive Science Colloquium - Dr. Brandon Turner
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department in Carnegie 113 on Wednesday, November 5th at noon for a presentation titled “Mechanisms of Selective Attention during Learning” by Dr. Brandon Turner of Ohio State University. Dr. Turner’s research interests include dynamic models of cognition and perceptual decision making, efficient methods for performing likelihood-free and likelihood-informed Bayesian inference, and unifying behavioral and neural explanations of cognition.

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Workshop: “Leading from Anywhere”
item.description: At Rensselaer, we maintain that “leadership” involves a learnable set of actions and behaviors that is available to everyone. Whether it be leading a particular project or initiative, assisting others in overcoming obstacles and capitalizing on opportunities, or catalyzing co-creation with colleagues, Rensselaer community members model leadership every day. In this workshop, participants will explore the tenants that comprise everyday leadership and discuss the behaviors that define leadership…
